customer_name: MINI S EXOTIC ZOO L L C

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
***In the front outdoor Lemur enclosure, there were two Ruffed Lemurs. The female Black and White Ruffed Lemur
named Trixie was observed expelling yellowish, extreme loose stool. There was also a moderate amount of loose stool on
top of the housing unit.
***In the Gibbon's enclosure down the hill, there were two Gibbons. There was dark brown, dried loose stool observed on
a portion of the enrichment (the braided hose).
***In the Gibbon's enclosure on the hill, containing two Gibbons, one Gibbon (Madee) was observed expelling a reddish
brown loose stool. The attending veterinarian had not been contacted.
Symptoms of illness that are left undiagnosed and untreated can worsen the illness or could spread to other animals.
The licensee must contact the attending veterinarian, follow the treatment plan and ensure that the use of appropriate
methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries is available to all animals as required.
This is a 2nd Re-License Inspection for a Class B license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 1 more inspection or by July 15, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
Additional Inspectors:
CYNTHIA DIGESUALDO, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.40(a)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
***In the front outdoor Lemur enclosure, there were two Ruffed Lemurs. The female Black and White Ruffed Lemur 
named Trixie was observed expelling yellowish, extreme loose stool. There was also a moderate amount of loose stool on 
top of the housing unit. 
***In the Gibbon's enclosure down the hill, there were two Gibbons. There was dark brown, dried loose stool observed on 
a portion of the enrichment (the braided hose).  
***In the Gibbon's enclosure on the hill, containing two Gibbons, one Gibbon (Madee) was observed expelling a reddish 
brown loose stool. The attending veterinarian had not been contacted.  
Symptoms of illness that are left undiagnosed and untreated can worsen the illness or could spread to other animals. 
The licensee must contact the attending veterinarian, follow the treatment plan and ensure that the use of appropriate 
methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries is available to all animals as required. 
 
This is a 2nd Re-License Inspection for a Class B license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 1 more inspection or by July 15, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and 
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
CYNTHIA DIGESUALDO, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
